Ini Pengemudi Mobil 'Terbang' yang Hantam Ibu Jogging di Batam
04 Nov 2019, 17:12 by Audrey Santoso
Jakarta - Perempuan berinisial FL (23) pengemudi mobil 'terbang' yang hantam warga berolahraga di Harbour Bay, Batam, Kepri, ditetapkan polisi menjadi tersangka. FL salah injak pedal gas hingga akhirnya mobil melaju kencang menabrak pembatas lalu 'terbang'.
"Pengemudi salah injek rem, malah diinjak gas akhirnya out of control. Mobilnya loncat menabrak pembatas jalan," ujar Kabid Humas Polda Kepri Kombes S Erlangga saat dimintai konfirmasi, Senin (4/11/2019).
Kecelakaan ini terjadi sekitar pukul 05.30 WIB, Sabtu (2/11). Pemilik mobil, perempuan berinisial SL (26) saat itu memarkirkan mobilnya bernomor polisi BP 1916 AM di kawasan Harbour Bay, Batam. SL dan FL menurut polisi sebelumnya menginap di rumah temannya kawasan Bukit Indah Sukajadi pada Jumat (1/11) malam.


Pengemudi mobil 'terbang' yang hantam warga di Batam Foto: Dok. Kepolisian

Pada pagi hari, FL dan SL menumpang taksi online untuk mengambil mobil yang diparkir. SL, pemilik mobil, meminta FL mengemudikan kendaraan.
"Karena ngantuk, pemilik (SL) kasih bawa temannya," sambung Erlangga.
Saat itu, mobil yang dikemudikan FL melaju kencang setelah menginjak pedal gas lalu menabrak pembatas jalan dan menghantam seorang ibu yang sedang berolahraga. Korban mengalami cedera tulang bahu sebelah kiri, cedera lecet dan memar di wajah.
"Korban lagi dirawat di rumah sakit Malaysia," kata Kasat Lantas Polresta Barelang AKP Muchlis Nadjar dihubungi terpisah.

This is the 'Flying' Car Driver Hit by Mother Jogging in Batam
Nov 04 2019, 17:12 by Audrey Santoso
Jakarta - The woman with the initial FL (23) a 'flying' car driver who hit residents exercising in Harbor Bay, Batam, Riau Islands, was determined by the police to be a suspect. FL wrong stepped on the gas pedal until finally the car drove fast crashing into the barrier and then 'fly'.
"Drivers hit the wrong brakes, even stepped on the gas finally out of control. His car jumped hit the road divider," said Head of Public Relations of the Riau Islands Police Commissioner S Erlangga when asked for confirmation, Monday (4/11/2019).
This accident occurred at around 05.30 West Indonesia Time, Saturday (2/11). The car owner, a woman with the initial SL (26) at that time parked her car with the police number BP 1916 AM in the Harbor Bay area, Batam. SL and FL, according to the police, previously stayed at his friend's house in the Bukit Indah Sukajadi area on Friday (1/11) night.


Drivers of 'flying' cars that hit residents in Batam Photo: Doc. Police

In the morning, FL and SL took a taxi online to pick up a parked car. SL, the car owner, asks FL to drive the vehicle.
"Because sleepy, the owner (SL) gave his friend," continued Erlangga.
At that time, a car driven by FL drove fast after stepping on the gas pedal then crashed into the road divider and hit a mother who was exercising. The victim suffered an injury to the left shoulder bone, blisters and bruises on the face.
"The victim is being treated at a Malaysian hospital," said Kasat Soas Barelang Police AKP Muchlis Nadjar contacted separately.
